page.title: 17THORPE'S ELDER STATESWOMAN
page.content: {MRS. MARGERY C. WRIGHT}IS THE CHAIRMAN OF THORPE-LE-SOKEN PARISH COUNCIL, A POSITION SHE HAS HELD SINCE THE EARLY 1950s. SHE CAME TO LIVE IN THORPE IN 1926 AND WAS ELECTED TO THE PARISH COUNCIL IN ABOUT 1945 - SHE DOES NOT REMEMBER THE EXACT YEAR. SHE WAS ALSO THORPE'S REPRESENTATIVE ON THE OLD TENDRING RURAL DISTRICT COUNCIL OF WHICH SHE WAS CHAIRMAN IN 1965-66-67 AND IN THIS CAPACITY SHE ATTENDED 3 ROYAL GARDEN PARTIES AT BUCKINGHAM PALACE. WHEN LOCAL GOVERNMENT REORGANISATION TOOK PLACE, SHE WAS ELECTED TO SERVE THORPE AND BEAUMONT ON THE NEW TENDRING DISTRICT COUNCIL. BEFORE HER RETIREMENT IN 1975 SHE TRAVELLED TO LONDON EVERY DAY TO WORK. SHE AND HER BROTHER OWNED A FACTORY MAKING LEATHER FOR LADIES' SHOES. NOW OVER 80 YEARS OLD, SHE PLANS TO RETIRE FROM THE COUNCIL IN TWO YEARS'TIME.
